title: We are officially nerds
content:
[David Brookes writes about nerds:](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907035054/http:/www.nytimes.com/2008/05/23/opinion/23brooks.html?em&ex=1211688000&en=01ff46e1aad3c12d&ei=5087_)

<cite>They can visit eclectic sites like Kottke.org and Cool Hunting, experiment with fonts, admire Stewart Brand and Lawrence Lessig…</cite>
author: James Puckett

comments.content: So NYT readers have to suffer David Brooks because Paul Krugman is off today? Sheesh.
“The Nerd, the Geek & the Light Saber” .

That quotation is about geeks, not nerds. It’s a bit confusing though; the article uses the terms nerds and geeks mostly in opposition to each other, but in places implies that geeks are a subset of nerds, like a new breed.
